snippet: After Kenneth Chamberlain Sr., 68, said he didn’t need an ambulance, officers removed his apartment door from its hinges, fired a Taser and then killed him.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column recounts killing of Kenneth Chamberlain Sr, former Marine with heart problems who accidentally triggered his Life Alert pendant, by New York City police; police say Chamberlain threatened them with a knife after alert brought ambulances and officers to his White Plains home, but family members say police caused fear and escalated situation.
lead_paragraph: After Kenneth Chamberlain Sr., 68, said he didn’t need an ambulance, officers removed his apartment door from its hinges, fired a Taser and then killed him.

headline.seo: Fatal Shooting of Ex-Marine by White Plains Police Raises Questions
headline.main: ‘Officers, Why Do You Have Your Guns Out?’
headline.print_headline: ‘Officers, Why Do You Have Your Guns Out?’
